H0.text: Attracts insects for food is how the brown‑colored bird sitting on a tree branch in the forest most likely survives.

H1.text: Warns predators of its defense helps the brown‑colored bird survive in the forest by alerting predators to its defensive capabilities while perched on a tree branch.

H2.text: Hides it from predators is how the bird's brown color most likely helps it survive in the forest where it sits on a tree branch.

H3.text: Allowing it to stay warm is how the brown‑colored bird’s brown color most likely helps it survive in the forest where the bird sits on a tree branch.

A4.text: Many animals have evolved to visually resemble their surroundings through cryptic coloration.

A5.text: Some animals actively camouflage themselves with local materials.
